name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Multiethnic American Literatures

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Mu: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Multiethnic American Literatures The Certificate of Undergraduate Study (CUGS) in Multiethnic American Literatures offers non-majors the opportunity to study, in-depth, key texts and contexts of ethnic American literatures. Students will cultivate a critical awareness of the ways in which mutually constitutive categories of ethnicity, race, indigeneity, class, gender, and sexuality inform the evolution of African American, Asian American, Latino/a, and Native American literary canons.

courses.subject: ENGL
courses.title: Critical Methods I for English Majors

courses.subject: ENGL
courses.title: Multiethnic Literatures of the United States

notes: One of the following courses: 3 s.h.
Three of the courses listed below: 9 s.h.

Total Required Credits for the Program: 12 s.h. To earn a CUGS in Multiethnic America Literatures, students must earn a C- or above in each of the four courses (12 s.h.). Christine Larsen-Britt Advisor 856.256.4068 larsen-britt@rowan.edu
